channel.title: Help!
channel.description: Can I get a moderator in here to help me out and explain everything about creating my own server to me as if i was extremely slow in the head. Technology hates me so please be patient with me. thanks!

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Scottishere:

for the guide, i dont know diff between internet ip and computer/gateway ip

Connecting IP Networks

Gateways that connect two IP-based networks, like TCP/IP with IPX/SPX, have two IP addresses, one on each network. An address like 192.168.1.xxx is a Local Area Network address, and is the address to which traffic is sent from the LAN. The other IP address is the Wide Area Network address, this is the address to which traffic is sent coming from the WAN. When this is the Internet, that address is usually assigned by an ISP.

When talking about the gateway IP address, commonly the LAN-address of the gateway is meant.

The addresses of computers connected to the LAN are hidden behind the gateway. That is, the WAN can only see the gateway’s IP address. To regulate traffic between the WAN and the LAN, the gateway commonly performs Network Address Translation (NAT), presenting all of the LAN traffic to the WAN as coming from the gateway’s WAN IP address and doing packet sorting and distribution of return WAN traffic to the local network.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

IP means ‘Internet Protocall’. It is somewhat akin to the notion of an address, street number etc. Computer IP would be, basically, the IP that your computer has.

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Scottishere:

the java things i need to download, if i play rs will i still need to download em?

Nope. RS uses exactly the same software that MoparScape uses. Although, if you want to actually change anything, you will need a JDK. You’ll find a link to one in the same place PaulT reffered you.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Ok.

Now download Moparscape. Also, if you don’t have java already, download the java JDK and JRE (http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp).

Finally, run moparscape, click 'Start Server" then log in with whatever username and password you like.

Now that you’ve started a server the most basic way and verified you have what you need, follow this tutorial and work on customizing your own server.

Read full topic
